messageBody:
Folks,

I've been watching this thread for a while, but missed the beginning.
Has anyone mentioned JUnit4's ability to mark tests @ignore? That's
a potentially huge business plus. Developers can add all their tests
(tagged @ignore) at the beginning of a cycle (and more whenever they
think of them) without polluting the current status numbers with
spurious failures. In my experience, that fear has lead to an "I'll
add it later" tendency which, of course, most often gets forgotten.
This new feature could pay for the whole transition in better
test-based progress tracking.

Lance Zant
